verbs.description: unbutton (third-person singular simple present unbuttons, present participle unbuttoning, simple past and past participle unbuttoned)

entries.meaning: (transitive, intransitive) To open (something) by undoing its buttons.
(intransitive, ergative) To come open by having its buttons unfastened.
examples: He was so muscled and firm, and the canvas shirt under his jacket unbuttoned easily.
